isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE REDUCTION, SINGLE DRIVE AXLES: EATON - WHEEL DIFFERENTIAL LOCK - REMOVAL AND DISASSEMBLY

svcsubproc.title: Differential Carrier Assembly from Axle Housing

important.para: When removing axle shafts, identify left and right shaft location for reference during reassembly.

step1.para: Drain axle lubricant and disconnect driveline, following instructions for your specific axle.
Disconnect lead wires at selector switch and air line at shift cylinder.
To facilitate removal of the differential carrier assembly, the differential lock should be engaged and held in the engaged position. This can be accomplished by one of two methods:

svcsubproc.para: Use an auxiliary air line and apply 80 to 120 psi air pressure to shift cylinder air port to engage clutch.
Install an M12x1.5 bolt, over 1.5 inches (38 mm) long, in the cylinder air port to manually engage the clutches.

note.para: Hand tighten the bolt. Over-tightening may cause damage to the shift unit. To facilitate hand tightening, coat bolt threads with axle lube.
With either method, the axle shaft may have to be rotated to permit the clutch to become engaged.

step1.para: Continue removing differential carrier assembly following instructions for your specific axle.
For ease of servicing, mount differential carrier in stand with differential lock facing up ( Figure 55).

figure.caption: Figure 55. Mount Differential Carrier in Stand

step1.para: Remove pipe plug from differential carrier shift box ( Figure 56).

figure.caption: Figure 56. Remove Pipe Plug From Differential Carrier Shift Box

step1.para: Unscrew and remove selector switch and plastic washer from the carrier.
Working through the pipe plug opening, loosen the shift fork bolt with a hex socket wrench ( Figure 57).
Remove cylinder mounting bracket bolts, then lift shift cylinder, bracket, seal, piston and O-ring assembly off the carrier and end of push rod ( Figure 58).

note.para: Do not disassemble shift cylinder unless it is suspected of requiring service. The shift cylinder is serviced only as an assembly.

step1.para: To disassemble shift cylinder for inspection, remove seal and slide mounting bracket off cylinder. The piston and O-ring assembly can be removed by inserting a pencil-shaped tool through the cylinder air port ( Figure 59).

figure.caption: Figure 59. Disassemble Shift Cylinder For Inspection

step1.para: Grasp push rod end and pull it out of the shift fork and carrier ( Figure 60).

figure.caption: Figure 60. Pull Push Rod Out of Shift Fork and Carrier

note.para: When push rod is disengaged from the shift fork, the fork and sliding curvic clutch assembly can be removed from the carrier.

Do not disassemble shift fork from the sliding clutch unless parts replacement is necessary. To disassemble, use pin punch to remove spring pin from long leg of fork. The fork can now be disengaged from the clutch.

step1.para: Remove the switch actuator and compression spring from the shift box opening ( Figure 61).

figure.caption: Figure 61. Remove Switch Actuator and Compression Spring

step1.para: Remove the snap ring, then lift the fixed curvic clutch off the differential case hub spline ( Figure 62and Figure 63).
